abstract: Javier Martin-Artajo was released soon after his arrest on Tuesday morning, beginning what could be a lengthy extradition process over charges that he hid billions in trading losses.
snippet: Javier Martin-Artajo was released soon after his arrest on Tuesday morning, beginning what could be a lengthy extradition process over charges that he hid billions in trading losses.
lead_paragraph: Updated, 8:42 p.m. | Weeks after the United States government charged Javier Martin-Artajo, a former JPMorgan Chase employee, with hiding trading losses that ultimately reached more than $6 billion, he had his first day in court on Tuesday as he surrendered to Spanish authorities and kicked off what could be a lengthy extradition process.

headline.main: Former JPMorgan Trader Surrenders in Spain in ‘London Whale’ Case
headline.print_headline: Former JPMorgan Employee Surrenders in Spain in ‘London Whale’ Case

byline.original: By Ben Protess and Raphael Minder
